title: Design - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin January 24, 2006 SEO vs. Conversion Debate Shouldn't Exist Design Michael Nguyen, whose Social Patterns blog often has cool stuff, wrote an entry last week that made me wonder about som continuing myths in SEO: Before optimization a site is converting about ... Read this post E By: EGOL January 17, 2006 Visitors Judge a Site in 1/20th of a Second Design Just saw this article at Nature about how visitors to a website can form an impression about it in just 50 milliseconds. We all think that content is important but this article argues that ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 14, 2006 Updating a Logo Design I noticed a highly linked-to post on Fizbang web design that covered how to re-touch and update a logo. Interestingly enough, Matt just re-made the logo for SEOmoz (for our new business cards and new website - on its way). Check out a walkthrough: ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 9, 2006 Good Points in Designers vs. SEOs Thread Design Good thread today at SEW on the subject of the Flash-designer portfolio set of web developers and their feelings on SEO. Glengara starts things off: I started a thread on whether all-Flash sites should be used in the commercial web, (my premise being that using Fla... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 14, 2005 Reading Blogs via RSS Design I've got almost 50 blogs I like to read every day and another 100 or so that I like to see at least once a week. But, I'm sorely behind the times. I actually go and visit every blog in my browser to get the content, rather than using a feedreader. Why? Because I can't find a reader that I like... I've tried several (bloglines, google's web version, start.com) and never been satisfied. A... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 9, 2005 Cozy vs. Sterile Design Design JewelryJean at cre8asite is asking about choosing between "homespun" design that is more cozy vs. a more sterile, professional design. The crowd jumps in with some terrific advice and points to a few resources that help provide evidence for the argument that profe... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 6, 2005 Yes, Virginia, Design can be Link Bait, too Design I've struggled for a while trying to find this URL, that I was sure I emailed myself and sure enough, there it was, right in the email, getting overlooked the last 50 times I searched for it. But, my own tagging problems aside, this site, ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 28, 2005 E-Commerce Done Right at Design Public Design I visited Design Public, an online furniture & gift store, on a whim last night. Low and behold, I've discovered that their online presence is doing literally everything right... Well written Title Ta... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 23, 2005 Open-Source Full Text Editor for Content Applications Design I've been using KTML and Matt's home-written code for a while now with SEOmoz, but I'm thinking of making the switch to FCKEditor. The name reminds me of the London fashion firm - French Connection United Kingdom (FCUK), but it's actually a good-looking system. You can try it for free on this page and download the installation sof... Read this post M By: mozUser1469147917838 October 31, 2005 Click tracking tools 101 Design Both Rand and Egol have recently discussed about MyBlogLog, and I am about to joing the group. I admit that MyBlogLog is nice tool, but for professional marketing specialist there are loads of similar, or even more advanced tools avai... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 18, 2005 Dilbert on User Interface Design Design Scottie Claiborne, who co-authors the hilarious ISOS blog and who bought me lunch on her last trip into Seattle, delivers this stellar ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 11, 2005 Alternative Web Page Editors Design I've noticed Bluefish getting a lot of attention lately, particularly in light of Adobe's acquisition of Macromedia and the proposed combination of the two most popular editors in the marketplace today - Dreamweaver (which... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin September 20, 2005 Debating the Value of Outbound Links Design Over at Sitepoint forums, Aspen (a very well-respected and knowledgable member of their community) disagrees with me on whether outbound links on a web page can affect your rankings at the search engines. My views: "I believe that search... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin September 8, 2005 The Importance of an About Page Design Kim's got a terrific thread going at Cre8asite on the importance of "about us" or "about me" pages. She starts by pointing to Andy Beal's ... Read this post
